mechanosensation.notes: As sponges, Stylocordylidae likely possess mechanosensory abilities to detect water currents and physical stimuli. This is inferred from the general physiology of sponges.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges rely on chemoreception to detect food particles and other chemical signals in the water. This is a fundamental aspect of their filter-feeding lifestyle.

photosensitivity.notes: Photosensitivity in Stylocordylidae is unknown. Sponges generally lack complex visual systems, and the presence of light-sensitive cells in this family has not been documented.
